name: Bear Grylls Quick Guide
description: This is a catch-all category for quality-of-life improvements available in modded Minecraft. This is stuff you want to pay attention to when you switch to a "real" modpack that might have quests of its own. These little tips and tricks can save you a lot of trouble before you hit post-scarcity.

quests.name: The Fabric Of Our Lives
quests.description: Cotton is a farmable resource for string and wool. Don't ask how cotton turns into wool. It's Minecraft magic! Anyways, this is great way to make bags and items before you get your hands on leather. Don't trivialize it. You actually want to start farming this first! If you can't find cotton plants in the wild, go on a grass punching spree and you'll eventually net some cotton seeds. You can put individual cotton in a crafting grid to get more seeds afterwards.

tasks.longDescription: I want 8 cotton to show you've put some thought into it!

quests.name: Have A Berry Good Time
quests.description: Natura provides berries: raspberries, blackberries, blueberries, and malobarries. They are individually nutritionally weak. You have farm a ton of them. However, they grow like mad. The most important part is you can slap a berry bush inside your base, on dirt, without a water source, and they will thrive! One bush will turn into three. I recommend setting up a wall of them. You can run down the line of them and go nuts . . . er, go berries!

tasks.longDescription: It's your dumb luck that you'll find raspberries when you are playing, but they are really common. Keep looking! You will eventually need all four kinds, and maloberries are the hardest. Hence, they are the quest reward.

quests.name: Hang In There!
quests.description: The hang glider is a lazy way to move from place-to-place if you can get up on a mountain somewhere. It requires an odd amount of leather, so be prepared to cook down some zombie flesh! Seriously, making a hang glider out of leather is kind of creepy. :(

tasks.longDescription: You need two wings.
...and now, the glider!

quests.name: Harvest All The Berries!
quests.description: If you combine all four types of berries together, you can make a berry medley. This is actually a pretty satisfying meal. This is useful in other modpacks that have jumbled up the hunger part of the game a little bit.

tasks.longDescription: This may take some time, but you will have 2/4 of the berry types before you hit this quest. Now it's a game of finding blackberries and blueberries. They are fairly common.

quests.name: Hipster Torches
quests.description: There are now a few different ways to make torches. The most important thing to know is you can make torches from stone rods. This is very useful when you are deep underground and run out of torches. You probably have found some coal, so you just make some rods out of cobblestone, and you can keep on mining. Alternate fuel sources now include rubber and ... burnt sugar. Yeah.

tasks.longDescription: The one obnoxious thing about stone rods is you'll have to run the stone through a furnace first. You probably have enough cobblestone to do this, so don't fuss it too much.
You can burn some sugar, or just use some rubber, to as fuel for torches.

quests.name: Your Ultimate Getaway
quests.description: The Last Millenium is a great place to remember how to spell "millennium" BECAUSE THEY SPELL IT WRONG!!! Beyond that, it is a monster-free, blank space where you are free to build your base in completely lazy comfort. This requires some ender pearls, but is oddly not too resource-intensive. The dyes, however, are unconventional, and you must actively work towards getting all this junk if you want to make the portal. One catch: If you choose to go back to the overworld, it will take you back to the world spawn, not where where you placed the portal.

tasks.longDescription: You need some purple and magenta dyes. Get your mittens on some rose red, bone meal, and lapis lazuli.

Don't forget the ender pearls! Once you make this thing, slap it down somewhere and right-click to enter. You can right-click on a block in the starting spot once you have beamed over to return. Use the chunkloader I give as a reward to keep the area running when you go back to the overworld/whatever to do things.
Time for a field trip! Oh, um, by the way, don't fall off the edge! And also, remember when you return, it's dropping you off at world spawn!

quests.name: Dividing By Diamond
quests.description: The division sigil opens up a few fun tools and toys. You can normally find these as dungeon loot. Since this is a tutorial modpack, I am not going to wait for you to find one, and just give you a division sigil here. However, it is not yet activated, which is a pain in the butt. You want to look this one up online. I will wait. You have to wrap a block in redstone, wait until midnight, slap an animal on the altar, and kill it. Then all hell breaks loose. But don't do it quite yet!

quests.name: Before The Sacrifice!
quests.description: When you trigger "the sacrifice," a bolt will come down and start turning all the dirt around the altar into "cursed earth." This spawns tougher versions of regular monsters very frequently. You want this dirt for a mob farm! Prepare a shovel with silk touch so you can harvest it.

tasks.longDescription: The silk touch gem requires and emerald and a pile of string. Hey, how about that cotton farm?

quests.name: This Sin-Cursed Earth
quests.description: You really only need one cursed earth block. So long as you place it in darkness--free from the sun, it will spread to surrounding dirt tiles. Monsters then are much more likely to spawn on it. This is great for a mob farm!

quests.name: The Builder's Wand
quests.description: This thing is hot stuff. I sometimes just cheat one in because I don't see why it should be THIS HARD to make one. Like, is it really "overpowered?" Whatever. The routine for making this involves unstable ingots using that division sigil. These things will blow up and kill you if you fart around, so I can't have an intermediate step here. You have to do this in one go. So look at the recipe for the builder's wand, then look at it again. Then make a crafting table a good 20-30+ blocks from your base in case you blow yourself up. Line up all your ingredients, and just fly through making this thing!

tasks.longDescription: No really, it's totally worth it! You can select an edge of a wall/floor you are building, and if you have items matching that edge in your inventory, it will just place them down for you over a large area. This is great for building our large structures!

quests.name: Deep Dork
quests.description: The deep dark is a dangerous place that isn't that much better of a place to be in this pack than other places. However, in other packs, it's worth trying. Hell, there is a survival pack that starts you here! You have to know it's very easy to die in it. Darkness actually hurts, and you have to bring tons of torches. The monsters are strong too. Also, there are holes in the world. I am not making it sound appealing, but it's fun to try at least once.

tasks.longDescription: This requires 4 quadruple-compressed cobblestone.

I did not pay too much attention to the quintiuple-compressed cobblestone requirement when I built this the first time. So I got blown sky-high when I tried to make the portal when I did not have one. This thing needs some unstable ingots, so you really need to make sure you have everything straight before you build it.

Finally, the portal. This requires unstable ingots. Again, these will blow you up if you don't handle them quickly enough! You want to set up a crafting table 20-30+ blocks away from your base, get all your stuff arranged together, and do this very quickly! We are talking 10 seconds here!

quests.name: Power Gloves
quests.description: This glove can be upgraded. In fact, the upgrades you place on it expand on any tools you use while wearing them. So you should slap tons of redstone on them! This makes your mining and bow draw speeds faster!

tasks.longDescription: All it takes is some leather.

quests.name: Jerky You Around
quests.description: In this modpack, making jerky is a waste of time. However, the hip challenge modpacks have a hunger mod that requires you eat a variety of foods to stay nourished. Jerky lets you draw out animal food sources just that little bit extra. To make jerky, build the jerky racks, then right click on them while holding a raw meat. They will then slowly turn into jerky over some time.

tasks.longDescription: Make a pile of these since meat takes some time to turn into jerky.

quests.name: Crawling In My Skin
quests.description: One of the best quality-of-life mods simply adds a recipe to convert zombie flesh into leather by running it through a furnace. Most good modpacks do this. Some don't because it's "unrealistic." Think about that for a minute. So instead of punching cows for leather, you can punch zombies for leather.

tasks.longDescription: I can't specifically enforce that you actually did the quest, but please just pay attention. When you get some rotten flesh, run it through a vanilla furnace--or any furnace for that matter--and get leather from it. What else were you going to do with it? Eat it?

I specifically made sure this made it into the pack for the original teambuilding exercise at work for which I made the pack in the first place. I had some folks from India that I was afraid would not want to punch cows for leather. When we started playing, they gleefully were pushing cows into lava pits and doing all kinds of crap to them. Then I found out they were from Pakistan. I am a terrible person.

quests.name: Pearl Diving
quests.description: Ender pearls are pretty obnoxious to get in vanilla Minecraft, and gate the end game part, if you are into that kind of thing. A lot of mods use ender pearls as ingredients. Artifice provides ender ore. It is strange stuff. I cannot tell you exactly where it generates, but I think it has a chance of generating when endermen spawn or teleport underground. I have good luck finding it around Y=12 in lava caves.

tasks.longDescription: Hey, just find it once and I'll feed you a pile of ender pearls.

quests.name: Bikini Bottom Visitor Kit
quests.description: Let's say you want to walk along the botton of the ocean? Maybe you want to build an undersea dome. Maybe you're playing a different modpack that doesn't spray clay, sand, and gravel everywhere? I have just the thing! Artifice provides armor upgrades that act like targeted enchantments. Take a fresh, sturdy helmet, put it in a crafting grid with these upgrades, one-at-a-time, and you can suddenly tolerate the ocean much more.

tasks.longDescription: These upgrades can be stacked, so if you don't like the original results, just apply more of them. I recommend reserving a special helmet for this that you only wear when going underwater. I will give you an armor stand so you can put it in a prominent spot.
